server.import.server.confirm:
The imported servers will overwrite previously imported servers if they have the same ID.
 If imported servers have the same ID as the manually added servers or discovered servers, servers with duplicate ID could show up. Servers that have been assigned a role and have duplicate ID will be highlighted in red. You can edit the server to update the ID.

 Do you still want to import servers?
server.import.server.confirm.limit.confl:
The imported servers without a role will overwrite previously imported servers without a role if they have the same ID.
 If imported servers have the same ID as the manually added servers or discovered servers, servers with duplicate ID could show up.
 Servers with roles that don't belong to the target roles will be ignored. Servers that have been assigned a role and have a duplicate ID, or IP address or MAC address or IPMI address will be ignored. 

 Do you still want to import servers?

model.summary.role.description.CONTROLLE:
Controller nodes run the cloud control plane services. They host Keystone, Horizon, Glance, and other essential cloud services in a single host.

  Example of services that run on a controller node:
    - apache2
    - cinder-api
    - cinder-scheduler
    - glance-api
    - glance-registry
    - heat-api
    - heat-api-cfn
    - heat-api-cloudwatch
    - heat-engine
    - neutron-dhcp-agent
    - neutron-metadata-agent
    - neutron-openvswitch-agent
    - neutron-server
    - neutron-vpn-agent
    - nova-api
    - nova-conductor
    - nova-consoleauth
    - nova-scheduler
    - nova-novncproxy
model.summary.role.description.COMPUTE-R:
Compute nodes provide compute services like nova-compute. They are hypervisors where workloads run.

  Example of services that run on Compute node:
    - neutron-l3-agent
    - neutron-lbaasv2-agent
    - neutron-metadata-agent
    - neutron-openvswitch-agent
    - nova-compute
model.summary.role.description.MTRMON-RO:
Metering & Monitoring nodes run the cloud services for metering and monitoring such as celiometer, monasca, and logging.

  Examples of services that run on a Metering & Monitoring node:
    - ntp-client
    - ceilometer-api
    - ceilometer-polling
    - ceilometer-agent-notification
    - ceilometer-common
    - ceilometer-client
    - cassandra
    - kafka
    - spark
    - logging-server
    - apache2
    - storm
    - monasca-api
    - monasca-persister
    - monasca-notifier
    - monasca-threshold
    - monasca-client
    - monasca-transform
    - zookeeper
    - freezer-api
model.summary.role.description.DBMQ-ROLE:
Database & Message Queue nodes run clustered MariaDB and RabbitMQ services to support the cloud infrastructure.

  Examples of services that run on a Database & Message Queue node:
    - ntp-client
    - mysql
    - rabbitmq
model.summary.role.description.SWOBJ-ROL:
Swift Object nodes run the Swift Object service.

  Examples of services that run on a Swift Object node:
    - ntp-client
    - swift-object
model.summary.role.description.CORE-ROLE:
Core nodes run core cloud services like keystone, nova api, glance api, neutron api, horizon, heat, etc..

  Examples of services that run on a Core node:
    - lifecycle-manager
    - tempest
    - apache2
    - keystone-api
    - cinder-api
    - cinder-scheduler
    - cinder-volume
    - cinder-backup
    - cinder-client
    - keystone-client
    - glance-api
    - glance-registry
    - glance-client
    - horizon
    - heat-api
    - heat-api-cfn
    - heat-api-cloudwatch
    - heat-engine
    - heat-client
    - ip-cluster
    - memcached
    - openstack-client
    - nova-api
    - nova-scheduler
    - nova-conductor
    - nova-console-auth
    - nova-novncproxy
    - nova-client
    - neutron-server
    - neutron-ml2-plugin
    - neutron-client
    - octavia-api
    - octavia-health-manager
    - ntp-server
    - ops-console-web
    - ops-console-monitor
    - barbican-api
    - barbican-client
    - barbican-worker
    - designate-api
    - designate-central
    - designate-pool-manager
    - designate-zone-manager
    - designate-mdns
    - designate-client
    - bind
    - magnum-api
    - magnum-conductor
model.summary.role.description.SWPAC-ROL:
Swift PAC nodes runs the Swift Proxy, Account, and Container services.

  Examples of services that run on a Swift PAC node:
    - ntp-client
    - swift-proxy
    - swift-account
    - swift-container
    - swift-ring-builder
    - swift-client
model.summary.role.description.NEUTRON-R:
Neutron nodes run Neutron cloud services like VPN (L3), DHCP, Metadata and OpenVswitch agents.

  Examples of services that run on a Neutron node:
    - ntp-client
    - neutron-vpn-agent
    - neutron-dhcp-agent
    - neutron-metadata-agent
    - neutron-openvswitch-agent
model.summary.role.description.ESX-COMPU:
ESX compute nodes are VM Appliances which run on ESX hypervisors. They provide nova proxy services for integrating Vmware ESX hypervisors into the cloud.

  Example of services that run on an ESX compute node:
    - nova-proxy
model.summary.role.description.OVSVAPP-R:
OVSvAPP nodes are VM Appliances runing on ESX hypevisors which provide network connectivity to VMs running on ESX hypervisors.

  Example of services that run on an OVSvAPP node:
    - neutron_ovsvapp_agent
    - openvswitch
model.summary.role.description.IRONIC-CO:
Ironic compute nodes are compute nodes created via bare metal provisioning.

  Example of services that run on an Ironic compute node:
    - neutron-l3-agent
    - neutron-lbaasv2-agent
    - neutron-metadata-agent
    - neutron-openvswitch-agent
    - nova-compute
model.summary.role.description.NOT_FOUND: These user-generated nodes are custom components created for specific purposes.
tooltip.network.addresses: IP addresses used to limit the network access. Addresses could be an IP range or an IP address. For example, 10.0.1.1-10.0.1.10 or 10.0.1.23
tooltip.network.cidr: Network address in Classless Inter-Domain Routing notation, such as 10.0.1.0/24
tooltip.network.vlanid: A valid VLAN id is an integer in the range of 1-4094.
